summary: mycoplasma pulmonis (MP) remains potentially important rodent pathogen causing murine respiratory mycoplasmosis (MRM) two female Wistar rats were observed to be diseased in animal facility of NISER, Bhubaneswar, and were kept in isolation for further investigation. both were found to be positive for MP after serological and molecular tests. sp. is a Gram-negative bacterium lacking a cell wall causing murine respiratory mycoplasmosis. this disease frequently goes undiagnosed due to subclinical nature. it becomes important to diagnose MP infection due to its potential interference with a wide variety of research. commonly observed clinical signs include sneezing, nasal discharge with dyspnea or rales, and also torticollis in the case of middle/internal ear infection Conventional colony of out-bred stocks of Wistar rat was housed in static cages. temperature and humidity ranging between 243°C and 40-70%. animals were exposed to 12 h light/12 h dark cycle as routine practice. euthanasia of experimental animals by overexposure to CO2 seemed most suitable for pulmonary studies. tracheal washings and infected lung tissue were collected during postmortem examination. a 26-gauge needle was cut blunt along the plastic hub and inserted into the trachea. about 0.5 ml of phosphate-buffered saline was flushed in and out of trachea. DNA extraction was done using 275 l of tracheal washing. 20 mg of lung tissue was done using SV Genomic DNA Purification System. the present incidence of MP infection was detected during routine health monitoring of animals. two female Wistar rats were observed to be diseased thus kept in isolation for further serological, pathological, and molecular investigations. the whole rat colony comprising of 36 animals was segregated based on clinical symptoms. ml centrifuge tube was centrifuged at 5000 rpm for 5 min. serum was then stored for further analysis. tracheal washings and infected lung tissue were collected. DNA extraction was done using 275 l of tracheal washing. 20 mg of lung tissue was done using SV Genomic DNA Purification System.
